titles.title: Amending rule XXIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives to permit the employing office of an employee of the House who serves in a reserve component of the uniformed services to pay the employee an additional salary for any period during which the employee is on active duty.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Technology and the House.

bill.summary: 5/7/2003--Introduced. Amends the Rules of the House of Representatives to permit the employing office of any employee who serves on active duty (other than for training) as a member of the reserves with respect to any pay period during the 108th Congress to pay additional compensation to the employee for that pay period, as long as the additional compensation does not exceed the difference between the amount paid to the employee by the employing office for the most recent pay period before such active duty and the amount paid to the employee as a member for that pay period.
